title: Executive Order 7950-Exemption of William H. Egberts From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that William H. Egberts, chief preparator in anthropology in the United States National Museum, Smithsonian Institution, who, during the month of September, 1938, will reach the retirement age prescribed for automatic separation from the service, applicable to him, be exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby exempt the said William H. Egberts from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending September 30, 1939.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 7950-Exemption of William H. Egberts From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362912
